fullForm: Institute of National Importance Combined Entrance Test
eligibility: Candidates must possess an MBBS degree for MD/MS/DM (6 yrs)/MCh (6 yrs) and a BDS degree for MDS from a recognized institution and must have completed or be due to complete the required internship.
negativeMarking: Yes (1 mark for correct answer, negative marking for incorrect answers; exact value NA)
examFrequency: Twice a year (January and July sessions)

faqs.question: What is the full form of INI CET and who conducts it?
faqs.answer: INI CET stands for Institute of National Importance Combined Entrance Test and is conducted by AIIMS, New Delhi for admission to postgraduate medical courses in Institutes of National Importance across India.
